chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat

Goal:
prime (nthprime n)

Premises:
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
nthprime = fun n : nat => iter nxtprime 2 n : nat -> nat Arguments nthprime _%nat_scope
first_prime_above : forall m : nat, {p : nat | m < p /\ prime p /\ (forall q : nat, m < q -> prime q -> p <= q)}
prime_above : forall m : nat, {p : nat | m < p /\ prime p}
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ divides p n}
prime_decomp : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list nat | n = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l /\ Forall prime l}
prime_divides : forall p q : nat, prime p -> prime q -> divides p q -> p = q
prime_in_decomp : forall (p : nat) (l : list nat), prime p -> Forall prime l -> divides p (fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l) -> In p l
nxtprime_spec2 : forall n : nat, prime (nxtprime n)
prime_decomp_uniq : forall l m : list nat, Forall prime l -> Forall prime m -> fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 m -> l ~p m
prime_neq_0 : forall p : nat, prime p -> p <> 0
prime_dec : forall p : nat, {prime p} + {~ prime p}
prime_ge_2 : forall p : nat, prime p -> 2 <= p
prime_bool_spec : forall p : nat, prime_bool p = true < -> prime p
prime_bool_spec' : forall p : nat, prime_bool p = false < -> ~ prime p
lprod_ge_1 : forall l : list nat, Forall prime l -> 1 <= fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l
prime_gcd : forall p q : nat, prime p -> is_gcd p q 1 \/ divides p q
prime_rect : forall P : nat -> Type, P 0 -> P 1 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> P p) -> (forall x y : nat, P x -> P y -> P (x * y)) -> forall n : nat, P n
prime_div_mult : forall p x y : nat, prime p -> divides p (x * y) -> divides p x \/ divides p y
notprime_bool_rec_spec : forall n k : nat, notprime_bool_rec n k = true < -> (forall i : nat, n <= i < k + n -> ~ prime i)
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> divides p x -> divides p y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lnot = fun a n : nat => Nat.lxor a (Nat.ones n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lnot (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lcm = fun a b : nat => a * (b / Nat.gcd a b) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lcm (_ _)%nat_scope
nxtprime = fun n : nat => proj1_sig (first_prime_above n) : nat -> nat Arguments nxtprime _%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.ltb = fun n m : nat => S n <=? m : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.ltb (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
divides_bool = fun n p : nat => match p mod n with | 0 => true | S _ => false end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments divides_bool (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.to_uint = fun n : nat => Decimal.rev (Init.Nat.to_little_uint n (Decimal.D0 Decimal.Nil)) : nat -> Decimal.uint Arguments Init.Nat.to_uint _%nat_scope
fact = fix fact (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => S n0 * fact n0 end : nat -> nat Arguments fact _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope

```coq
unfold prime, nthprime. apply (proj2_sig (first_prime_above (S n))).
Qed.```
